001/*
002 * Renderer 18. The MIT License.
003 * Copyright (c) 2022 rlkraft@pnw.edu
004 * See LICENSE for details.
005*/
006
007package renderer.pipeline;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import static renderer.pipeline.PipelineLogger.*;
012
013import java.awt.Color;
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.ArrayList;
016
017/**
018   Clip a (projected) {@link Triangle} that sticks out of
019   the view rectangle in the image plane.  Interpolate
020   {@link Vertex} color from any clipped off {@code Vertex}
021   to a new {@code Vertex}.
022*/
023public class Clip_Triangle
024{
025   /**
026      If the {@link Triangle} sticks out of the view rectangle,
027      then clip it so that it is contained in the view rectangle.
028      <p>
029      When we clip a triangle, we may end up with as many as ten
030      new sub-triangles. The new, clipped, sub-triangles are
031      gathered into the return {@link List}.
032
033      @param model  {@link Model} that the {@link Triangle} {@code t} comes from
034      @param t      {@link Triangle} to be clipped
035      @return a {@link List} that is either empty or contains clipped {@code Triangle}s
036   */
037   public static List<Primitive> clip(final Model model,
038                                      final Triangle t)
039   {
040      // Create an empty Primitive list to hold
041      // the clipped Triangle objects.
042      final List<Primitive> doneList = new ArrayList<>();
043
044      // Create an empty Triangle list to hold Triangle
045      // objects that still need clipping.
046      final List<Triangle> toDoList = new ArrayList<>();
047
048      toDoList.add(t);
049
050      while ( ! toDoList.isEmpty() )
051      {
052         final Triangle t2 = toDoList.remove(0);
053
054         // Make local copies of several values.
055         final int index0 = t2.vIndexList.get(0);
056         final int index1 = t2.vIndexList.get(1);
057         final int index2 = t2.vIndexList.get(2);
058
059         final Vertex v0 = model.vertexList.get( index0 );
060         final Vertex v1 = model.vertexList.get( index1 );
061         final Vertex v2 = model.vertexList.get( index2 );
062
063         final double x0 = v0.x,  y0 = v0.y;
064         final double x1 = v1.x,  y1 = v1.y;
065         final double x2 = v2.x,  y2 = v2.y;
066
067         // 1. Check for trivial accept.
068         if ( ! ( Math.abs( x0 ) > 1
069               || Math.abs( y0 ) > 1
070               || Math.abs( x1 ) > 1
071               || Math.abs( y1 ) > 1
072               || Math.abs( x2 ) > 1
073               || Math.abs( y2 ) > 1 ) )
074         {
075            // This triangle doesn't need clipping, so put it in the done list.
076            if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Trivial accept.");
077            doneList.add(t2);
078         }
079         // 2. Check for trivial delete.
080         else if ( (x0 >  1 && x1 >  1 && x2 >  1)  // right of the line x=1
081                || (x0 < -1 && x1 < -1 && x2 < -1)  // left of the line x=-1
082                || (y0 >  1 && y1 >  1 && y2 >  1)  // above the line y=1
083                || (y0 < -1 && y1 < -1 && y2 < -1) )// below the line y=-1
084         {
085            if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Trivial delete.");
086         }
087         // 3. Need to clip this triangle.
088         else if (x0 > 1 || x1 > 1 || x2 > 1) // crosses the line x = 1
089         {
090            // Clip to the  line x = +1.
091            //if (Clip.debug) System.err.println("-- Clip to x = +1");
092            if (x0 > 1 && x1 > 1)
093            {// Create one new Triangle containing previous v2 and new v0, v1.
094               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v0 & v1 at x = 1.");
095               interpolateNewTriangle(model, t2, 2, 0, 1, toDoList, 1);
096            }
097            else if (x0 > 1 && x2 > 1)
098            {// Create one new Triangle containing previous v1 and new v0, v2.
099               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v0 & v2 at x = 1.");
100               interpolateNewTriangle(model, t2, 1, 2, 0, toDoList, 1);
101            }
102            else if (x1 > 1 && x2 > 1)
103            {// Create one new Triangle containing previous v0 and new v1, v2.
104               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v1 & v2 at x = 1.");
105               interpolateNewTriangle(model, t2, 0, 1, 2, toDoList, 1);
106            }
107            else if (x0 > 1)
108            {// Create two new Triangles, neither containing previous v0.
109               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v0 at x = 1.");
110               interpolateNewTriangles(model, t2, 0, 1, 2, toDoList, 1);
111            }
112            else if (x1 > 1)
113            {// Create two new Triangles, neither containing previous v1.
114               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v1 at x = 1.");
115               interpolateNewTriangles(model, t2, 1, 2, 0, toDoList, 1);
116            }
117            else if (x2 > 1)
118            {// Create two new Triangles, neither containing previous v2.
119               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v2 at x = 1.");
120               interpolateNewTriangles(model, t2, 2, 0, 1, toDoList, 1);
121            }
122            else  // We should never get here.
123            {
124               System.err.println("Clipping to x = +1 dropped a triangle!");
125               Thread.dumpStack();
126               System.exit(-1);
127            }
128         }
129         else if (x0 < -1 || x1 < -1 || x2 < -1) // crosses the line x = -1
130         {
131            // Clip to the line x = -1.
132            //if (Clip.debug) System.err.println("-- Clip to x = -1");
133            if (x0 < -1 && x1 < -1)
134            {// Create one new Triangle containing previous v2 and new v0, v1.
135               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v0 & v1 at x = -1.");
136               interpolateNewTriangle(model, t2, 2, 0, 1, toDoList, 2);
137            }
138            else if (x0 < -1 && x2 < -1)
139            {// Create one new Triangle containing previous v1 and new v0, v2.
140               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v0 & v2 at x = -1.");
141               interpolateNewTriangle(model, t2, 1, 2, 0, toDoList, 2);
142            }
143            else if (x1 < -1 && x2 < -1)
144            {// Create one new Triangle containing previous v0 and new v1, v2.
145               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v1 & v2 at x = -1.");
146               interpolateNewTriangle(model, t2, 0, 1, 2, toDoList, 2);
147            }
148            else if (x0 < -1)
149            {// Create two new Triangles, neither containing previous v0.
150               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v0 at x = -1.");
151               interpolateNewTriangles(model, t2, 0, 1, 2, toDoList, 2);
152            }
153            else if (x1 < -1)
154            {// Create two new Triangles, neither containing previous v1.
155               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v1 at x = -1.");
156               interpolateNewTriangles(model, t2, 1, 2, 0, toDoList, 2);
157            }
158            else if (x2 < -1)
159            {// Create two new Triangles, neither containing previous v2.
160               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v2 at x = -1.");
161               interpolateNewTriangles(model, t2, 2, 0, 1, toDoList, 2);
162            }
163            else  // We should never get here.
164            {
165               System.err.println("Clipping to x = -1 dropped a triangle!");
166               Thread.dumpStack();
167               System.exit(-1);
168            }
169         }
170         else if (y0 > 1 || y1 > 1 || y2 > 1) // crosses the line y = 1
171         {
172            // Clip to the line y = +1.
173            //if (debug) System.err.println("-- Clip to y = +1");
174            if (y0 > 1 && y1 > 1)
175            {// create one new Triangle containing previous v2 and new v0, v1.
176               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v0 & v1 at y = +1.");
177               interpolateNewTriangle(model, t2, 2, 0, 1, toDoList, 3);
178            }
179            else if (y0 > 1 && y2 > 1)
180            {// Create one new Triangle containing previous v1 and new v0, v2.
181               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v0 & v2 at y = +1.");
182               interpolateNewTriangle(model, t2, 1, 2, 0, toDoList, 3);
183            }
184            else if (y1 > 1 && y2 > 1)
185            {// Create one new Triangle containing previous v0 and new v1, v2.
186               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v1 & v2 at y = +1.");
187               interpolateNewTriangle(model, t2, 0, 1, 2, toDoList, 3);
188            }
189            else if (y0 > 1)
190            {// Create two new Triangles, neither containing previous v0.
191               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v0 at y = +1.");
192               interpolateNewTriangles(model, t2, 0, 1, 2, toDoList, 3);
193            }
194            else if (y1 > 1)
195            {// Create two new Triangles, neither containing previous v1.
196               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v1 at y = +1.");
197               interpolateNewTriangles(model, t2, 1, 2, 0, toDoList, 3);
198            }
199            else if (y2 > 1)
200            {// Create two new Triangles, neither containing previous v2.
201               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v2 at y = +1.");
202               interpolateNewTriangles(model, t2, 2, 0, 1, toDoList, 3);
203            }
204            else  // We should never get here.
205            {
206               System.err.println("Clipping to y = +1 dropped a triangle!");
207               Thread.dumpStack();
208               System.exit(-1);
209            }
210         }
211         else if (y0 < -1 || y1 < -1 || y2 < -1) // crosses the line y = -1
212         {
213            // Clip to the line y = -1.
214            //if (Clip.debug) System.err.println("-- Clip to y = -1");
215            if (y0 < -1 && y1 < -1)
216            {// Create one new Triangle containing previous v2 and new v0, v1.
217               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v0 & v1 at y = -1.");
218               interpolateNewTriangle(model, t2, 2, 0, 1, toDoList, 4);
219            }
220            else if (y0 < -1 && y2 < -1)
221            {// Create one new Triangle containing previous v1 and new v0, v2.
222               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v0 & v2 at y = -1.");
223               interpolateNewTriangle(model, t2, 1, 2, 0, toDoList, 4);
224            }
225            else if (y1 < -1 && y2 < -1)
226            {// Create one new Triangle containing previous v0 and new v1, v2.
227               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v1 & v2 at y = -1.");
228               interpolateNewTriangle(model, t2, 0, 1, 2, toDoList, 4);
229            }
230            else if (y0 < -1)
231            {// Create two new Triangles, neither containing previous v0.
232               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v0 at y = -1.");
233               interpolateNewTriangles(model, t2, 0, 1, 2, toDoList, 4);
234            }
235            else if (y1 < -1)
236            {// Create two new Triangles, neither containing previous v1.
237               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v1 at y = -1.");
238               interpolateNewTriangles(model, t2, 1, 2, 0, toDoList, 4);
239            }
240            else if (y2 < -1)
241            {// Create two new Triangles, neither containing previous v2.
242               if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Clip off v2 at y = -1.");
243               interpolateNewTriangles(model, t2, 2, 0, 1, toDoList, 4);
244            }
245            else  // We should never get here.
246            {
247               System.err.println("Clipping to y = -1 dropped a triangle!");
248               Thread.dumpStack();
249               System.exit(-1);
250            }
251         }
252         else // We should never get here.
253         {
254            System.err.println("Triangle Clipping Error!");
255            Thread.dumpStack();
256          //System.err.println(Arrays.toString(Thread.currentThread().getStackTrace()));
257            System.exit(-1);
258         }
259      }
260      return doneList;
261   }
262
263
264   /**
265      This method takes three indices for three vertices, one that is on
266      the "right" side of a clipping line and the other two that are on the
267      "wrong" side of the clipping line, a "todo" {@link List} into which
268      a new clipped {@link Triangle} should be put (since it may need to
269      be clipped again), and an integer which specifies which clipping line
270      to use when calling {@link #interpolateNewVertex}.
271      <p>
272      The three vertices should be given in a counterclockwise ordering around the triangle.
273      <p>
274      When this method returns, it will have placed in {@code triangleList}
275      a clipped {@link Triangle} with the index index0_inside and the indices
276      for two new interpolated vertices, both of which have been put into
277      the {@link Model}'s vertex list.
278
279      @param model           {@link Model} object that holds the vertex list
280      @param tri             the {@link Triangle} being clipped
281      @param index0_inside   the index in {@code tri} of the {@link Vertex} that is inside the view rectangle
282      @param index1_outside  the index in {@code tri} of a {@link Vertex} that needs to be clipped off
283      @param index2_outside  the index in {@code tri} of a {@link Vertex} that needs to be clipped off
284      @param triangleList    {@link List} to hold new {@link Triangle} object that replaces the clipped {@link Triangle}
285      @param eqn_number      the identifier of the line crossed by the {@link Triangle}
286   */
287   private static void interpolateNewTriangle(final Model model,
288                                              final Triangle tri,
289                                              final int index0_inside,
290                                              final int index1_outside,
291                                              final int index2_outside,
292                                              final List<Triangle> triangleList,
293                                              final int eqn_number)
294   {
295      if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Create one new triangle.");
296
297      // Interpolate a new vertex between index0_inside and index1_outside.
298      // The new vertex, color, and texture coordinate objects are at the
299      // end of the model's vertex, color, and texture coordinate lists.
300      interpolateNewVertex(model,
301                           tri,
302                           index0_inside,
303                           index1_outside,
304                           eqn_number);
305
306      // Interpolate a new vertex between index0_inside and index2_outside.
307      // The new vertex, color, and texture coordinate objects are at the
308      // end of the model's vertex, color, and texture coordinate lists.
309      interpolateNewVertex(model,
310                           tri,
311                           index0_inside,
312                           index2_outside,
313                           eqn_number);
314
315      // Create a new Triangle primitive using the new vertex.
316      // Make sure it has the same orientation as the original triangle.
317      // (We cannot reuse the original Triangle object since we don't
318      //  know which vertex is in which location of the triangle.)
319      final int vIndex1_new  = model.vertexList.size() - 2;
320      final int cIndex1_new  = model.colorList.size() - 2;
321      final int vIndex2_new  = model.vertexList.size() - 1;
322      final int cIndex2_new  = model.colorList.size() - 1;
323
324      final Triangle tri_new;
325      if (! tri.textured)
326      {
327         tri_new = new Triangle(tri.vIndexList.get(index0_inside),
328                                vIndex1_new,
329                                vIndex2_new,
330                                tri.cIndexList.get(index0_inside),
331                                cIndex1_new,
332                                cIndex2_new,
333                                tri.cIndexList2.get(0),
334                                tri.cIndexList2.get(1),
335                                tri.cIndexList2.get(2));
336      }
337      else // a textured Triangle
338      {
339         final int tcIndex1_new = model.texCoordList.size() - 2;
340         final int tcIndex2_new = model.texCoordList.size() - 1;
341         tri_new = new Triangle(tri.vIndexList.get(index0_inside),
342                                vIndex1_new,
343                                vIndex2_new,
344                                tri.cIndexList.get(index0_inside),
345                                cIndex1_new,
346                                cIndex2_new,
347                                tri.cIndexList2.get(0),
348                                tri.cIndexList2.get(1),
349                                tri.cIndexList2.get(2),
350                                tri.tcIndexList.get(index0_inside),
351                                tcIndex1_new,
352                                tcIndex2_new,
353                                tri.textureIndex);
354      }
355
356      // Add the Triangle to the end of the todo list
357      // since the Triangle may need to be clipped again.
358      triangleList.add(tri_new);
359
360      //if (Clip.debug) logMessage( tri_new.toString() );
361   }//interpolateNewTriangle()
362
363
364   /**
365      This method takes three indices for three vertices, two that are on
366      the "right" side of a clipping line and one that is on the "wrong"
367      side of the clipping line, a "todo" {@link List} into which two new
368      clipped {@link Triangle} objects should be put (since they may need
369      to be clipped again), and an integer which specifies which clipping
370      line to use when calling {@link #interpolateNewVertex}.
371      <p>
372      The three vertices should be given in a counterclockwise ordering around the triangle.
373      <p>
374      When this method returns, it will have placed in {@code triangleList}
375      two new {@link Triangle} objects, one from the two inside vertices to
376      a new interpolated vertex, and the other triangle from the two new
377      interpolated vertices to one of the original inside vertices. Two new
378      {@link Vertex} objects will have also been added to the {@link Model}'s
379      vertex list.
380
381      @param model           {@link Model} object that holds the vertex list
382      @param tri             the {@link Triangle} being clipped
383      @param index0_outside  the index in {@code tri} of the {@link Vertex} that needs to be clipped off
384      @param index1_inside   the index in {@code tri} of a {@link Vertex} that is inside the view rectangle
385      @param index2_inside   the index in {@code tri} of a {@link Vertex} that is inside the view rectangle
386      @param triangleList    {@link List} to hold two new {@link Triangle} objects that replace the clipped {@link Triangle}
387      @param eqn_number      the identifier of the line crossed by the triangle
388   */
389   private static void interpolateNewTriangles(final Model model,
390                                               final Triangle tri,
391                                               final int index0_outside,
392                                               final int index1_inside,
393                                               final int index2_inside,
394                                               final List<Triangle> triangleList,
395                                               final int eqn_number)
396   {
397      if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Create two new triangles.");
398
399      // Interpolate a new vertex between v1_inside and v0_outside.
400      // The new vertex, color, and texture coordinate objects are at the
401      // end of the model's vertex, color, and texture coordinate lists.
402      interpolateNewVertex(model,
403                           tri,
404                           index1_inside,
405                           index0_outside,
406                           eqn_number);
407
408      // Interpolate a new vertex between v2_inside and v0_outside.
409      // The new vertex, color, and texture coordinate objects are at the
410      // end of the model's vertex, color, and texture coordinate lists.
411      interpolateNewVertex(model,
412                           tri,
413                           index2_inside,
414                           index0_outside,
415                           eqn_number);
416
417      final int vIndex0_new1 = model.vertexList.size() - 2;
418      final int cIndex0_new1 = model.colorList.size() - 2;
419      final int vIndex0_new2 = model.vertexList.size() - 1;
420      final int cIndex0_new2 = model.colorList.size() - 1;
421
422      // Create a new Triangle primitive using the first new vertex.
423      // Make sure it has the same orientation as the original triangle.
424      // (We cannot reuse the original Triangle object since we don't
425      //  know which vertex is in which location of the triangle.)
426      final Triangle tri_1;
427      if (! tri.textured)
428      {
429         tri_1 = new Triangle(vIndex0_new1,
430                              tri.vIndexList.get(index1_inside),
431                              tri.vIndexList.get(index2_inside),
432                              cIndex0_new1,
433                              tri.cIndexList.get(index1_inside),
434                              tri.cIndexList.get(index2_inside),
435                              tri.cIndexList2.get(0),
436                              tri.cIndexList2.get(1),
437                              tri.cIndexList2.get(2));
438      }
439      else // a textured Triangle
440      {
441         final int tcIndex0_new1 = model.texCoordList.size() - 2;
442         tri_1 = new Triangle(vIndex0_new1,
443                              tri.vIndexList.get(index1_inside),
444                              tri.vIndexList.get(index2_inside),
445                              cIndex0_new1,
446                              tri.cIndexList.get(index1_inside),
447                              tri.cIndexList.get(index2_inside),
448                              tri.cIndexList2.get(0),
449                              tri.cIndexList2.get(1),
450                              tri.cIndexList2.get(2),
451                              tcIndex0_new1,
452                              tri.tcIndexList.get(index1_inside),
453                              tri.tcIndexList.get(index2_inside),
454                              tri.textureIndex);
455      }
456
457      // Create a new Triangle primitive using the two new vertices.
458      final Triangle tri_2;
459      if (! tri.textured)
460      {
461         tri_2 = new Triangle(vIndex0_new2,
462                              vIndex0_new1,
463                              tri.vIndexList.get(index2_inside),
464                              cIndex0_new2,
465                              cIndex0_new1,
466                              tri.cIndexList.get(index2_inside),
467                              tri.cIndexList2.get(0),
468                              tri.cIndexList2.get(1),
469                              tri.cIndexList2.get(2));
470      }
471      else // a textured Triangle
472      {
473         final int tcIndex0_new1 = model.texCoordList.size() - 2;
474         final int tcIndex0_new2 = model.texCoordList.size() - 1;
475         tri_2 = new Triangle(vIndex0_new2,
476                              vIndex0_new1,
477                              tri.vIndexList.get(index2_inside),
478                              cIndex0_new2,
479                              cIndex0_new1,
480                              tri.cIndexList.get(index2_inside),
481                              tri.cIndexList2.get(0),
482                              tri.cIndexList2.get(1),
483                              tri.cIndexList2.get(2),
484                              tcIndex0_new2,
485                              tcIndex0_new1,
486                              tri.tcIndexList.get(index2_inside),
487                              tri.textureIndex);
488      }
489
490      // Add the two Triangles to the end of the todo list
491      // since the Triangles may need to be clipped again.
492      triangleList.add(tri_1);
493      triangleList.add(tri_2);
494
495      //if (Clip.debug) logMessage( tri_1.toString() );
496      //if (Clip.debug) logMessage( tri_2.toString() );
497   }//interpolateNewTriangles()
498
499
500   /**
501      This method takes in two vertices, one that is on the "right" side
502      of a clipping line and the other that is on the "wrong" side of the
503      clipping line, and an integer which specifies which clipping line
504      to use, where
505      <pre>{@code
506         eqn_number == 1 means clipping line x =  1
507         eqn_number == 2 means clipping line x = -1
508         eqn_number == 3 means clipping line y =  1
509         eqn_number == 4 means clipping line y = -1
510      }</pre>
511      This method adds to the {@link Model}'s vertex list the vertex
512      that is the intersection point between the given line segment
513      and the given clipping line.
514      <p>
515      This method solves for the value of {@code t} for which the
516      parametric equation
517      <pre>{@code
518                  p(t) = (1-t) * v_outside + t * v_inside
519      }</pre>
520      intersects the given clipping line. (Notice that the equation
521      is parameterized so that we move from the outside vertex towards
522      the inside vertex as {@code t} increases from 0 to 1.) The solved
523      for value of {@code t} is then plugged into the parametric formula
524      to get the coordinates of the intersection point. The solved for
525      value of {@code t} is also used to interpolate a new {@link Color}
526      object for the new vertex, and the new {@link Color} object is
527      added to the end of the {@link Model}'s color list.
528
529      @param model     {@link Model} object that holds the vertex list
530      @param tri       the {@link Triangle} being clipped
531      @param inside    the index in {@code tri} of the {@link Vertex} that is inside the view rectangle
532      @param outside   the index in {@code tri} of the {@link Vertex} that is outside the view rectangle
533      @param eqn_number  the identifier of the view rectangle edge crossed by the line segment
534   */
535   private static void interpolateNewVertex(final Model model,
536                                            final Triangle tri,
537                                            final int inside,
538                                            final int outside,
539                                            final int eqn_number)
540   {
541      if (Clip.debug) logMessage("-- Create new vertex.");
542
543      // Make local copies of several values.
544      final Vertex v_inside  = model.vertexList.get( tri.vIndexList.get(inside) );
545      final Vertex v_outside = model.vertexList.get( tri.vIndexList.get(outside) );
546      final Color  c_inside  = model.colorList.get( tri.cIndexList.get(inside) );
547      final Color  c_outside = model.colorList.get( tri.cIndexList.get(outside) );
548
549      final double vix = v_inside.x; // "i" for "inside"
550      final double viy = v_inside.y;
551      final double viz = v_inside.z;
552      final float ci[] = c_inside.getRGBColorComponents(null);
553      final double vox = v_outside.x; // "o" for "outside"
554      final double voy = v_outside.y;
555      final double voz = v_outside.z;
556      final float co[] = c_outside.getRGBColorComponents(null);
557
558      // Interpolate between v_outside and v_inside.
559      double t = 0.0;
560      if (1 == eqn_number)            // clip to x = 1
561         t = (1 - vox) / (vix - vox);
562      else if (2 == eqn_number)       // clip to x = -1
563         t = (-1 - vox) / (vix - vox);
564      else if (3 == eqn_number)       // clip to y = 1
565         t = (1 - voy) / (viy - voy);
566      else if (4 == eqn_number)       // clip to y = -1
567         t = (-1 - voy) / (viy - voy);
568
569      //if (t < 0.9999999)
570      //t = t + 0.0000001;  /*** keep the new vertex off the edge!! ***/
571
572      // Use the value of t to interpolate the coordinates of the new vertex.
573    //final double x = (1-t) * vox + t * vix;
574    //final double y = (1-t) * voy + t * viy;
575    //final double z = (1-t) * voz + t * viz;
576      final double x = vox + t * (vix - vox);
577      final double y = voy + t * (viy - voy);
578      final double z = voz + t * (viz - voz);
579
580      final Vertex v_new = new Vertex(x, y, z);
581
582      // Use the value of t to interpolate the color of the new vertex.
583      final float t_ = (float)t;
584    //final float r = (1-t_) * co[0] + t_ * ci[0];
585    //final float g = (1-t_) * co[1] + t_ * ci[1];
586    //final float b = (1-t_) * co[2] + t_ * ci[2];
587      final float r = co[0] + t_ * (ci[0] - co[0]);
588      final float g = co[1] + t_ * (ci[1] - co[1]);
589      final float b = co[2] + t_ * (ci[2] - co[2]);
590
591      final Color c_new = new Color(r, g, b);
592
593      // Modify the Model to contain the new Vertex and Color.
594      model.vertexList.add(v_new);
595      model.colorList.add(c_new);
596
597      // Use the value of t to interpolate the texture coordinates of the new vertex.
598      if (tri.textured)
599      {
600         final TexCoord tc_inside  = model.texCoordList.get( tri.tcIndexList.get(inside) );
601         final TexCoord tc_outside = model.texCoordList.get( tri.tcIndexList.get(outside) );
602
603       //final double sTex = (1-t) * tc_outside.s + t * tc_inside.s;
604       //final double tTex = (1-t) * tc_outside.t + t * tc_inside.t;
605         final double sTex = tc_outside.s + t * (tc_inside.s - tc_outside.s);
606         final double tTex = tc_outside.t + t * (tc_inside.t - tc_outside.t);
607         // Modify the Model to contain the new TexCoord.
608         model.texCoordList.add(new TexCoord(sTex, tTex));
609      }
610
611      if (Clip.debug)
612      {
613         logMessage(String.format("-- t = % .25f", t));
614         logMessage(String.format("-- <x_o,y_o,z_o> = <% .24f % .24f % .24f",
615                                       vox,voy,voz));
616         logMessage(String.format("-- <x_i,y_i,z_i> = <% .24f % .24f % .24f",
617                                       vix,viy,viz));
618         logMessage(String.format("-- <x,  y,  z>   = <% .24f % .24f % .24f",
619                                       x,  y,  z));
620         logMessage(String.format("-- <r_o,g_o,b_o> = <% .15f  % .15f  % .15f>",
621                                       co[0], co[1], co[2]));
622         logMessage(String.format("-- <r_i,g_i,b_i> = <% .15f  % .15f  % .15f>",
623                                       ci[0], ci[1], ci[2]));
624         logMessage(String.format("-- <r,  g,  b>   = <% .15f  % .15f  % .15f>",
625                                       r,  g,  b));
626      }
627   }
628
629
630
631   // Private default constructor to enforce noninstantiable class.
632   // See Item 4 in "Effective Java", 3rd Ed, Joshua Bloch.
633   private Clip_Triangle() {
634      throw new AssertionError();
635   }
636}
